channel.title: Combined Politepol Feed
channel.description: Merged feed from multiple Politepol sources

item.title: Cyclone Horacio is the first Category 5 storm of 2026: Will India be hit?
AI boom, mass layoffs & more: Why Citrini Research’s report has spooked markets
How India and Israel have grown closer in the Modi era
Can Trump calm voters’ economic concerns with the State of the Union speech?
How ‘Trump is a man of action’ SMS alert sent Iran into panic
As new US tariffs come into effect today, how India could be at an advantage
Waiting for the hammer: Iran’s regime on the brink as Trump holds the final nail
item.description: History shows us that all brutal regimes have expiry dates. The mullahs' is here

item.title: How PM Modi’s Israel visit is crucial amid escalating West Asian tensions
item.description: PM Narendra Modi’s upcoming visit to Israel is strategically significant, as it comes at a time of heightened volatility in West Asia, with the serious threat of a US/Israel conflict with Iran looming. India’s longstanding ties with Israel and other regional powers could play a crucial role in reducing tensions

item.title: How access to critical minerals will determine the new world order
item.description: In the era of backward integration with natural resources, the focus has shifted to securing supplies of critical minerals and rare earth elements, as they are key ingredients for modern technology, the global energy transition, national defence, and taking the lead in the space era

item.title: Phantom turns 90: A masked hero’s Indian odyssey haunted by colonial baggage
item.description: The stories of Phantom project India as a colourful, exotic puzzle that forms the backdrop for a Western crime-fighter’s daredevilry

item.title: Why supporting the Kurdish cause serves India’s interests
item.description: It is time for the world’s largest democracy to embrace and cultivate the world’s largest people without a nation

item.title: After the tariff rebuke: How India should recalibrate its US strategy
item.description: The constitutional rebuke in Washington has reshaped the bargaining environment. New Delhi would be prudent to adjust its negotiating architecture accordingly
